args.query: mathlib4 Subgroup.map image homomorphism normal subgroup Subgroup.map is_normal

args.natural_language_statement: Translate to Lean4: If φ is a homomorphism of G onto G' and N ⫽ G (normal subgroup of G), show that φ(N) ⫽ G' (the image of N under φ is a normal subgroup of G'). End the Lean statement with := by sorry. Use Mathlib import at the top and save as a theorem named Herstein_exercise_2_7_7.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
Exercise: If φ is a homomorphism of G onto G' and N ⫽ G (N is a normal subgroup of G),
show that φ(N) ⫽ G' (the image of N under φ is a normal subgroup of G').
-/

theorem Herstein_exercise_2_7_7 {G G' : Type _} [Group G] [Group G'] (φ : G →* G')
  (hφ : Function.Surjective φ) (N : Subgroup G) (hN : Subgroup.Normal N) :
  Subgroup.Normal (Subgroup.map φ N) := by sorry
